channel.title: Security on CEDIS
channel.description: Recent content in Security on CEDIS

item.title: Cibersecurity
item.description: Cybersecurity consists of a set of practices, technologies, and methodologies aimed at protecting systems, networks, and data against unauthorized access, cyberattacks, persistent threats, and security failures. Its central goal is to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information, especially in increasingly complex and interconnected digital environments.

item.title: Sergio Antônio Andrade de Freitas
item.description: Full Professor at the University of Brasília (UnB), working in the undergraduate Software Engineering program and the Graduate Program in Applied Computing.

item.title: George Marsicano Correa
item.description: Associate Professor at the University of Brasília (UnB), working in the undergraduate Software Engineering program and the Graduate Program in Applied Computing.
